lead_paragraph: GINSBERG--Robert K.,died peacefully on January 26, 2016 at age 91. He was a devoted and beloved husband, father and grandfather and an accomplished professional engineer. Born May 23, 1924 in New York City to Bill and Tania Ginsberg, he was educated at Lincoln School and Yale University and served as a Lieutenant (jg) in the United States Navy during World War II, seeing extensive combat in the Pacific. He was a lifelong New Yorker who practiced engineering as principal in the firm William Ginsberg Associates, and he was for more than five decades a national leader in the design and construction of newspaper production facilities. He is survived by his beloved wife of 37 years, Nellie Wilson. He was predeceased by his first wife, Helen (1926-71) and is survived by their three children, Nina (Charles Smith) of Richmond, CA, William (Ellen Kelly) of New Haven, CT and John (Kathleen) of New York City. He is also survived by his grandchildren (Alex Smith, Susan Smith Emberley, Emily Ginsberg Dellisant, Julian Ginsberg, Connor Ginsberg, and Nina Ginsberg) and many other dear family members. A superb whistler, he lived with song in his heart and on his lips throughout his nine decades of loves and laughs and friends and joys. Gentle, kind and loving, he will be forever missed. A memorial service will be announced. 1/3
